rationale: Basic demographic data routinely captured in EHR demographics section. Easy to obtain directly without imputation.
Standard demographic field always available in EHR. No imputation needed.
Commonly required but often missing or subjective; inferable from clinical notes, visit frequency, and functional assessments in EHR. Worth imputing to expand eligibility.
Frequently required but rarely documented numerically; predictable using ML models from PS, comorbidities, and EHR data. Imputation expands matching.
Available from vitals, BMI calculations, and routine labs like albumin. Directly obtainable.
Typically documented in social history; easy to extract. Routine intake data.
Requires tumor genomic sequencing or FISH, not standard in EHR.
Requires specific NGS or PCR testing, unavailable in standard EHR.
Requires genomic profiling or IHC/FISH, not routinely in EHR.
Specific somatic mutations detected via NGS panels, not inferable from standard EHR.
Depends on comprehensive tumor NGS results, requiring specialized testing.
Requires IHC staining on tumor tissue, not available in standard EHR.
Determined by IHC/FISH assays, specialized pathology not routine.
Requires ctDNA NGS or flow cytometry, prospective specialized assay.
Extractable from pathology reports in EHR. Routinely documented.
TNM staging and summaries available in oncology notes and reports.
Confirmed via pathology, biopsy reports in EHR.
Details from imaging, pathology in EHR.
Assessable via RECIST from serial imaging reports; often implicit, worth imputing.
Documented in staging scans and progress notes.
Inferred post-treatment from imaging/notes; commonly required but not always explicit.
Commonly required; inferred from serial imaging, notes, and treatment changes in EHR.
Detectable from timeline of scans, rising markers, biopsies; often needs imputation.
Reported in MRI/CT head imaging and neuro notes.
Routine LFTs like ALT/AST/bilirubin in labs.
Creatinine, eGFR from standard labs.
CBC parameters like ANC, platelets routine.
Aggregate of routine labs for major organs.
EF from echoes, troponins if tested.
ECG reports and cardiology notes in EHR.
PFT results documented when performed.
CT chest findings and pulmonology evaluations.
Vitals trends and problem list.
History, imaging, D-dimer in records.
PT/PTT, history, hematology notes.
Active medications list.
Vascular surgery notes, imaging.
Problem list, immunology labs, rheumatology.
Recent cultures, WBC, antibiotics in notes.
Viral serologies and PCR often screened/documented.
Routine screening labs or infectious disease records.
PPD/Quantiferon history or chest imaging.
Serologies documented in relevant cases like lymphoma.
Immunoglobulin levels, CD4, transplant history.
Cancer registry, problem list, treatment history.
Oncology treatment timelines in EHR.
Medication and infusion records.
Specific agents in treatment history.
Chemo regimens documented.
Medications like bevacizumab in records.
Radiation oncology plans and dosimetry.
Combined modality treatment records.
Treatment intent documented in oncology notes.
Detailed medication and regimen history.
Surgical history and operative reports.
Assessment from imaging, MDT notes; often subjective and worth imputing.
EBUS, PET-CT, pathology staging.
Trial-specific scans may require prospective acquisition.
Requires biobanking or archival tissue verification.
Specialized germline NGS panels needed.
Graded AEs in progress notes and oncology records.
Computed from last dose dates in treatment history.
Current active medications list.
Clinical trial history in EHR.
Dedicated allergy module in EHR.
Inferred from comorbidities, labs, meds.
Medication reconciliation.
Transplant records and immunosuppression.
Immunization history and recent notes.
Routine screening questions and beta-HCG labs.
Prospective patient commitment and verification.
Endoscopy reports, symptom scales.
Chest imaging findings.
Neurology/psych notes, problem list.
TSH, free T4 labs.
HbA1c, glucose, endocrinology records.
Post-op notes, wound care documentation.
Urinalysis, albumin/creatinine ratio.
Ophthalmology consults if relevant.
Depends on investigational drug profile, prospective check.
Trial-specific procedure, not in standard EHR.
Prospective monitoring during trial.
Subjective trial eligibility judgment.
Timelines from encounter and treatment dates.
Recent diagnoses and visits.
Device registry, cardiology/surgery history.
Transfusion history, hemoglobin trends.
Based on tumor location/size from imaging; assessment often imputed.
Address/zip from patient demographics.
Inferred from lines of therapy and progression; commonly required but variable documentation.
Clinician judgment from disease/response data; worth predicting.
Serial labs like CEA, PSA in flow sheets.
